conbody.p: JDBC Consumer originJDBC namespace header attributesJDBC namespace header attributesJDBC ConsumerThe JDBC Consumer can generate JDBC namespace header attributes that provide additional information about each record, such as the original data type of a field or the source tables for the record. The origin receives these details from the JDBC driver.
You can use the record:attribute or record:attributeOrDefault functions to access the information in the attributes.

JDBC Consumer can provide the following JDBC namespace header attributes:
JDBC Namespace Header Attribute Description
<JDBC prefix>.tables Provides a comma-separated list of source tables for the fields in the record.Not all JDBC drivers provide this information.
<JDBC prefix>.<column name>.jdbcType Provides the original SQL data type for each field in the record.
<JDBC prefix>.<column name>.precision Provides the original precision for all numeric and decimal fields.
<JDBC prefix>.<column name>.scale Provides the original scale for all numeric and decimal fields.

To include the header attributes in the record, perform the following steps:
On the Advanced tab, select Create JDBC Namespace Headers.
Configure a JDBC Header Prefix. The default is "jdbc".
